articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Venezuela releases 13 jailed in crackdown following disputed elecions, opposition says
articles.description: Venezuelan authorities did not immediately confirm the releases, but opposition leaders like Henrique Capriles celebrated on social media, calling it a "step forward."
articles.content: Venezuelan authorities did not immediately confirm the releases, but opposition leaders like Henrique Capriles celebrated on social media, calling it a "step forward.

articles.description: Comedian Reggie Carroll died in a shooting on Wednesday in Southhaven, Mississippi.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Tropical Storm Juliette forms in the Pacific as Fernand churns over open waters in the Atlantic
articles.description: MIAMI — Tropical Storm Juliette formed Monday in the Pacific Ocean hundreds of miles from Mexico’s Baja California peninsula as Tropical Storm Fernand churned in the Atlantic Ocean
articles.content:
MIAMI Tropical Storm Juliette formed Monday in the Pacific Ocean hundreds of miles from Mexicos Baja California peninsula as Tropical Storm Fernand churned in the Atlantic Ocean.
No coastal watches

articles.author: Becca Wood, TODAY
articles.title: Why are artists like Morgan Wallen removing their names from Grammy consideration?
articles.description: Morgan Wallen has decided his Billboard 200 No. 1 album won’t be in the running for a 2026 Grammy Award, joining a list of artists who have boycotted the potential accolade

articles.author: Yamiche Alcindor, Megan Lebowitz
articles.title: Trump to sign an executive order to end cashless bail in D.C.
articles.description: Trump plans to sign an executive order Monday aimed at eliminating cashless bail for arrested suspects in Washington, D.C., a senior White House official said.
articles.content: WASHINGTON President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order Monday aimed at eliminating cashless bail for arrested suspects in Washington, D.C., a senior White House official said.

articles.author: Gary Grumbach, Marlene Lenthang, Rebecca Cohen
articles.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia taken into ICE custody at appointment
articles.description: BALTIMORE — Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who reunited with his family last week after 160 days apart following his mistaken deportation to El Salvador, was taken into ICE custody on Monday after an immigration check-in, his attorney said.
articles.content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who reunited with his family last week after 160 days apart following his mistaken deportation to El Salvador, was taken into ICE custody on Monday after an immigration check-in, his attorney said.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Keurig Dr Pepper to buy Peet's Coffee owner in $18 billion deal
articles.description: Keurig Dr Pepper said Monday it will buy Peet’s Coffee owner JDE Peet’s in a deal worth about $18 billion (15.7 billion euro)
articles.content: Keurig Dr Pepper said Monday it will buy Peet’s Coffee owner JDE Peet’s in a deal worth about $18 billion (15.7 billion euro)

articles.author: Jay Ganglani, The Associated Press
articles.title: France summons U.S. Ambassador Kushner over  antisemitism letter
articles.description: France has summoned the American ambassador to Paris after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging that the country had not taken “sufficient action” to combat antisemitism.
articles.content: France has summoned the American ambassador to Paris after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging that the country had not taken “sufficient action” to combat antisemitism.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Delisting of Chinese developer Evergrande closes tumultuous chapter for investors
articles.description: China Evergrande Group was kicked off the Hong Kong stock exchange on Monday in one of the largest delistings by market value and volume in recent years and marking an end to what’s been a tumultuous boom-and-bust saga for its investors.
articles.content: China Evergrande Group was kicked off the Hong Kong stock exchange on Monday in one of the largest delistings by market value and volume in recent years and marking an end to what’s been a tumultuous boom-and-bust saga for its investors.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Typhoon Kajiki batters Vietnam's coastal provinces
articles.description: It comes less than a year after Vietnam was hit by Typhoon Yagi, which killed 300 people.
articles.content: Vietnam's meteorological centre says the typhoon could trigger flash floods and landslides, and 400 communes across six provinces have been put on alert.

articles.title: Inside Donetsk as residents flee attacks on Ukrainian region Putin wants to control

articles.description: All six children were assessed at the scene and transferred to the ambulance service for further treatment.
articles.content:

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Half of UK job losses in hospitality, say bosses
articles.description: Lobby group calls for urgent action to lower taxes, but the government says it is helping establishments.
articles.content: An increase to the minimum wage, which came in this April, means that bosses have had to pay workers more in an environment where other costs, such as ingredients and energy bills, are also rising.

articles.title: Virginia Giuffre memoir to be published months after death
articles.description: She had finished working on the "intimate" and "heartbreaking" book before she took her own life in April, her publisher says.
articles.content: In 2022, the prince reached an out-of-court settlement with Ms Giuffre. The settlement included a statement in which he expressed regret for his association with Epstein, but contained no admission.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: 'Half alive': Mushroom lunch survivor tells court of murders' impact
articles.description: Family members of the three people Erin Patterson murdered with toxic mushrooms have confronted her in court.
articles.content: In the days after the meal at Patterson's home, her former in-laws Don and Gail Patterson, both 70, died in hospital, as well as Gail's sister, Heather Wilkinson, 66.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Get ready for fracking, Reform UK tells energy firms
articles.description: The party is serious about going after shale gas - but critics argue it's too difficult and costly.
articles.content: Fracking has been going on in the British oil and gas sector for decades and largely flew under the political radar until about 2010, when shale gas extraction started taking off in the United States.
